intro: Cryptocentrum caespitosum, commonly known as the dense cryptocentrum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, clustered leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of red and purple. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some tropical gardens.
